When using the dereferencing and deletion service, I certify that I have read and accepted the following conditions:
1- I certify that the personal information I used to identify myself is true and correct and I accept any liability whatsoever concerning the given information.
2- During the 14 days following the begining of the deletion and the dereferencing procedure, I authorize and mandate ForgetMyPicture to fill in the Google form for dereferencing requests https://support.google.com/legal/contact/lr_eudpa?product=websearch&hl=en and send it designating me as the requester and using my personal information.
3- During the 14 days following the beginning of the deletion and the dereferencing procedure, I authorize and mandate ForgetMyPicture to email website host administrators for deletion requests using the warning mail available here [link to the email].
4- For all the photos that I have selected, I certify that I am the one who launched the deletion and dereferencing procedure and I also accept to be considered as fully responsible of deleting or dereferencing these images.

Dear Sir or Madam,


On your Internet domain, I have found a detrimental photo of myself, which breaches my rights and my image. I would like to draw your attention to this situation.

Indeed, under Article 16 (ex Article 286 TEC) Title II of the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, and the Data Protection Act, I request that the photo be deleted [Photo URL] of your Internet domain.

Within two months, you have to respond to my request. Please contact me at the following email address [your e-mail address].

I should like also to remind you that, under the Data Protection Act, if an individual suffers damage, they are entitled to claim compensation from you.

In the absence of action from you, I shall be compelled to take legal action by exercising later my right to object

Thanking you in advance for your diligence,

Yours faithfully,

[your first name] [your family name]
